title: Convert
text: The equation can be rewritten as $$y \geq -2x-4$$

title: y-intercept
text: By plugging in the value $$x=0$$, we can conclude that the line will cross over $$(0,-4)$$ as the y-intercept

title: Slope
text: Given the equation, we can conclude that the slope of the equation is $$-2$$
speech: Given the equation, we can conclude that the slope of the equation is  minus 2
pacedSpeech: Given the equation, we can conclude that the slope of the equation is   minus 2

title: Line
text: Because the equation includes an "equal to" sign, it is a straight, non-dotted line, and the solution can be on the line
speech: Because the equation includes an "equal to" sign, it is a straight, non-dotted line, and the solution can be on the line
pacedSpeech: Because the equation includes an "equal to" sign, it is a straight, non-dotted line, and the solution can be on the line

title: Plug in
text: Plug in any coordinate value that is either on top or under the line but not on the line. If the value is accepted by the equation, then shade the side of the graph the point is on. (Ex: If point is above line and works, shade the area above line vice versa)

title: Match
